programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: Colorado won 13 of its last 15 meetings with the Ducks after a 4-2 win on Dec. 20 behind a goal and two assists from Nathan MacKinnon, along with a goal and assist from Cale Makar; Anaheim is 21-17-2 at home this season despite a losing road record.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Probable starters: TBD vs. Tyler Glasnow (1-0, 6.43); Glasnow issued five walks over two innings in his last start at Philadelphia, but the right-hander has a career record of 11-4 with a 3.32 ERA during the month of April.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Livan and Orlando Hernandez risked their lives to defect from Cuba in order to play Major League Baseball in the United States, and the two half-brothers made an unlikely journey from the impoverished island nation to pitching in the World Series.

programme.title: E:60
programme.desc: On June 2, 2010, Detroit Tigers pitcher Armando Galarraga was one out away from the first perfect game in franchise history, but a wrong call by umpire Jim Joyce would spoil that opportunity and cause backlash on a worldwide scale.

programme.desc: Mel Kiper Jr. reveals the fourth edition of his mock 2025 NFL Draft, going over the changes he made from his third mock, the players that are rising and falling on his board, along with the best fits for teams looking to address needs.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special
programme.desc: Mel Kiper Jr. and Todd McShay expound on their mock drafts, alternating picks through three rounds to predict how the 32 teams fill several holes on their roster, the players they believe who have improved their stock and the names that could fall.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special
programme.desc: NFL Draft experts analyze the quarterback class and review potential landing spots; top names expected to hear their name called early include: Miami's Cam Ward, Colorado's Shedeur Sanders, Alabama's Jalen Milroe and Ole Miss' Jaxson Dart.

programme.title: Gr8tness
programme.desc: A record once thought to be untouchable, Alex Ovechkin gives an all-access look as he chases the 894 goals of the legendary Wayne Gretzky, showing how he prepares for his games and the pressure he is facing to break the prestigious record.

programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: Destined to Drive: Patrick Dempsey's Return to Racing
Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Racing
programme.desc: Two-time defending champion Alex Palou increased its lead over Pato O'Ward to 39 points after winning at Thermal Club for a second-straight victory; Scott Dixon averaged 98.35 mph en route to his win at Long Beach last year over Colton Herta.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Denny Hamlin won back-to-back Cup Series races for the first time since 2012 following his victory at Darlington over points leader William Byron; Hamlin and Kyle Larson won the two races at Bristol last year over Martin Truex Jr. and Chase Elliott.

programme.desc: Two-time champion Francesco Bagnaia secured his first win of the season with his victory at COTA, while Alex Marquez passed his brother, Marc, in the standings by one point; Jorge Martin won the sprint race at Qatar last year over Brad Binder.

programme.title: MotoGP

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: New England and Atlanta split victories in their two meetings from the 2024 season, with the Revolution winning the final matchup on July 3 with a 2-1 scoreline; Giacomo Vrioni found the net with a brace for New England in the win at home.

programme.title: Bassmaster Elite Series
programme.desc: The highest level of professional bass fishing features pro anglers competing all season for the opportunity to win points toward the Progressive Bassmaster Angler of the Year award and to qualify for the Bassmaster Classic.

programme.desc: The top drag racing teams in the country compete in Top Fuel, Pro Stock and Funny Car; drivers accumulate points based on the results of each event and at the end of the season a champion is crowned in the various categories.

programme.desc: Cowboys, ranging in age from 11 to 53 and representing 31 states and fourth countries, compete in saddle bronc, steer wrestling, tie-down roping, bull riding, breakaway, bareback riding, barrel racing and team roping.
